website_summaries.verdict: An affordable inflatable pool with enough size for several kids and an adult. Offers reasonable durability and longevity for the price, adding to the value.
pros: This spacious model is crafted of sturdy material that resists rips and punctures better than most in this class and price range
Has two air chambers with two valves that make it fairly easy to inflate
cons: The drain plug is flimsy, and air has been known to leak from the valves, requiring additional fill-ups

customer_reviews.title: Great pool!
customer_reviews.text: 64 year old grandma here - got this pool to keep me cool - absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than we thought and it survived a 25 kid party.
customer_reviews.text: We have only used it a couple of times, but it survived a birthday party with 25 kids (we had 3 pools). It was bigger and more fun than we expected. There are 2 valves, a larger opening for easy quick filling with an electric pump and a smaller one for manual filling. Has been an awesome purchase for the summer.
customer_reviews.author: simplytaty

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice size. I'm very happy with the pool for the price however getting the water out of it after using it can be a hassle, besides that I love this pool. I bought it for my two year old niece and she loves it. It's very big. There's plenty of room for me to lay out and for her to play in. I'm happy with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Haylee Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Poor closing lid and needs separate Air Pump
customer_reviews.text: I didn't pay attention to the past reviews, paid the price. While the pool has a good size, it lacks on quality when you try to close the lid, its design is very poor, It's hard to close the lid and any stronger movement will blow the lid open... taking all the air from the pool. Another thing is that you need one of those Air mattress pumps, had to go borrow one because I didn't have.
customer_reviews.author: Camila

customer_reviews.title: Easily fits 2 adults and a child
customer_reviews.text: Really like this pool for cooling off with my baby and practicing her swim lessons but I have to add air to it every few days. It was easy to inflate with the same air pump I use for my air mattress, took about 15 mins, and only took about 45-60 mins to fill with water. It easily fits 2 adults and an 8 month old baby. I put foam mats underneath it for padding since the bottom doesn’t inflate and use a clear plastic drop cloth for a cover (purchased from Walmart for about $3). It works well and is inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: cheap- went through 2 in 2 weeks, both deflated on their own within a week
customer_reviews.text: Awful. This is my 2nd one in 2 weeks and it deflated as well. Amazon refunded sent me this 2nd one as a replacement but when this one failed too I didn't even bother trying to get another one as clearly there was a pattern of this being crap quality. I don't recommend. My kids did love it the first week it worked but pools should last longer than a week...
customer_reviews.author: Kaylin P.

customer_reviews.title: Get this today!
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect backyard pool. We bought it when our neighborhood pool was closed for the pandemic. My husband is 6'2" and I am 5'6" and we fit very comfortably. It is super easy to blow up with the shop vac, is incredibly sturdy and is the perfect height to sit back and read a book. Only suggestion is that it should have cup holders!
customer_reviews.author: SH03

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for 4 year old to splash around in the back yard. Inflated by hand and that was a chore but quick work of it. Draining is a challenge and you'll have to insert something to have the drain hole come off the floor or you'll be waiting for a long long time for draining. Seems durable and keeps air. Kid splashes around and walls hold. Only filled half way though. I'd recommend over cheaper ones since this one is larger and plenty of room for one kid to have a ball.
customer_reviews.author: rgv caster

customer_reviews.title: Cute looking pool but made poorly
customer_reviews.text: I am very unhappy with this pool. I would never buy it again and would not recommend it to anyone. I have had these small blow up pools previously and they have done well. However, this one is made of very thin vinyl and it got several holes in it which we had to keep repairing. Additionally, it is much deeper than most pools so if this is for a smaller child, do not fill it as much.
customer_reviews.author: Donnamarie

customer_reviews.title: Fun for indoors too
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep the kids entertained while on quarantine. We blew it up, which if you don’t have a device of some sort to do so it will take forever. Forever, the valves are not the average size can do blow up size they are big and it’s task full. We filled it up with pillows and blankets and they had a blast. The things I didn’t like about it is, 1. The smell it has a very plastic strong smell. 2. The time and effort it took to blow this thing up.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Price is great. Shipping was perfectly timed
customer_reviews.text: It's a classic! Price is great. Shipping was perfectly timed. The box survived delivery keeping the directions intact and readable. Inflation was reasonably quick and easy using a small Husky inflation pump. Once inflated the kids invaded it. They love it. It's taken quite a beating already and is still going strong. No air or water leaks. No sags or kinks. When we were finished I opened the drain plug and let it drain overnight and it was empty by morning. Other draining alternatives would be to use a siphon or a pump. Otherwise you need to be patient. This thing was a hit.
customer_reviews.author: jiski

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly large and durable!
customer_reviews.text: We were very pleasantly surprised by this. We've had it out in the yard for about a month now, and have drained and moved it several times with no leaks. We don't put anything under it. To get it to drain water, we do have to wedge plastic "stepping stones" under it around the plug to raise it off the ground enough to actually let the water flow, and we end up having to bail out about the last 1/3 or 1/4 of the water, but honestly that's to be expected. And it's big enough that even my tall-for-her-age 6-year-old can float on an inner tube and paddle around. Can't beat it for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Cabell H. Gathman

customer_reviews.title: Get a pump to air up and be careful to avoid holes
customer_reviews.text: Loves this pool till it got a hole in it and i spent HOURS trying to find it to no avail. My kids really weren't that rough on it. I only filled up one ring so my 1.5 year old could get in and out easily. One day my 3.5 and 1.5 year olds decided to sit on the ring and were bouncing, which I think is when the hold occurred. I recommend using a tarp underneath to avoid holes from rocks, leaves, or sticks. Plus, if you get a hole in the bottom, the tarp will keep it sealed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this little pool! We had a 4th of July celebration and it's been so hot here in the Midwest that I just knew we needed to let the little ones swim. Found a relatively level spot in the yard and filled it on up. The kids couldn't have been more thrilled! We filled past the max fill line with no issues, but even there, it would have been plenty deep to provide fun. This pool accommodated 5 kids, ages 3-6. Along with a few pool rings for floating, this pool was perfect for our needs. *Note - only used for 2 days, so can't attest to longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun for grandchildren they never want to go home! (Heehee)!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2pool I bought. The reason I got a second one is cause I didn't want to go to the storage to get it out. Being lazy so just bought a new one! I love this pool. My grand boys do to I recommend this pool it's loads of fun!! Best pool. My grand boys are 4-5-7 you can even put a slide in it.
customer_reviews.author: Joann Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase of the summer!
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids LOVED this pool. We couldn’t keep them out of it. It was way bigger than I thought it would be and very sturdy too. Absolutely NO complaints. I read some comments about it being hard to keep clean? I didn’t care if the water got dirty. They didn’t care. How can you stop it? They were jumping in and out, screaming and having a blast. I drained it (yes lots of water) hosed it down and refilled it the next day!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Dirty and damaged!
customer_reviews.text: Came in a damaged box but for me thats fine but when i open it, its horribly folded. You can tell its used! But okay, fine as long as it works. When fully inflated, i noticed its sooo dirty. Even has gum on the side. But fine, ill inflate it. After disinfecting, we filled it with water and had my son play in it. And behold!, it freakin deflated. I cant believe and still cant believe someone sent this to me. Ive bought this before so i trusted the product but never ever. Will not even return. Not worth my effort.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, but you earn that dip inflating it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It’s a pain to inflate (takes a lot of muscle with a hand pump and it doesn’t seem to work with an air compressor, but that could be operator error.) PAIN TO GET THE WATER OUT. For as much water as this holds, the hole to let out the water is the size of a quarter. You have to keep lifting it up to let the water out. It’s too heavy to just tip it over also.
customer_reviews.author: A. O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Literally not worth $5
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during quarantine to entertain the kids as a measure of last resort. First, you will need a pump to inflate it at all (sold separately). The pool has two inflation points: One for the top tube and another for the bottom tube. Both valves leaked since day one. At one point, I was re-inflating every 15 minutes or so. The kids quickly got bored of it, and so did I. It was in the trash about two weeks later.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H. Wolenski

customer_reviews.title: Easy to inflate but really poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one to save my kids during summer break. Although it is really easy to inflate with a pump, but it did not sealed properly. I was able to locate where the air was leaking, and it got deflated quickly. Little one got very disappointed so I ended up to order a glue for the latex. Really disappointing quality!
customer_reviews.author: stelisha

customer_reviews.title: but that's fine because it gives the kids more room to play
customer_reviews.text: Lovely pool! It is bigger than what I thought. I does take up the majority of our patio, but that's fine because it gives the kids more room to play. It does have a drain at the bottom, which is a plus when changing the water. Blowing it up is a pain, because the plug to blow it up is huge. I have no idea what the hubbie used to blow it up, but it worked. Overall, a great pool so far, and we have been using it for a couple of months now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was fun for an hour of play
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted one use and it got a leak in it that I couldn’t find. Made my stomach sick throwing it in the trash. Not sure if it was defective or not. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Cole

customer_reviews.title: I love it but. . .
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use as a giant raft like floaty for a group of people instead of a kid pool. I filled it up with air and it filled up really well. It was a lot bigger than I thought it would be. I am 5'1" and I could fully lie down with about a 2 ft left of space. The only problem I had was the plug. It opens so easily causing it to deflate. I will have to use duct tape to keep it closed. :(
customer_reviews.author: Da Critic

customer_reviews.title: Leaked upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Pool has two chambers with valves to inflate. The bottom chamber had a leak right out of the box by the valve. Couldn't patch. Read reviews with many others experiencing the same issue. Guess I was one of the unlucky ones too. Wish Intex had better quality testing of product before sending out for purchase,
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Very good pool
customer_reviews.text: Very good pool. Enough room to cool off for children or 2 adults. Material seems sturdy. The only problem I had was draining the pool. I had placed the pool on a tarp and the plug that drains the water was flat against the tarp/ground so I had to find something to lift that area so the water could drain out, since it was very heavy with the amount of water it holds.
customer_reviews.author: Joni H.

customer_reviews.title: Great pool and easy to blowup
customer_reviews.text: This pool has been well worth the money. We bought our first one in 2015 and i honestly just hoped it would last one summer. Now it’s 2020 and we finally need to order a new one, small leak in the bottom section so it doesn’t stay inflated very long on one side. Love the size and how easy it is to inflate (with a pump 😀)
customer_reviews.author: cafrank

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Offer a Leak-Proof Pool
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pool just about one year ago. Grand-daughter, 3 years old used it when she visited - maybe 5-10 times. Then drained, boxed. This year took out of box, inflated OK, filled with water - covered overnite hoping water would warm up. Over night air leaked out, water of course also leaked out. Inflated again and inspected could not find any leaks , have sprayed with a soapy-dishwash spray - NADA - there are many seams - leaks are not very fast but have not been able to find them. The pool was not abused or mis-handled. NOT a Very Well constructed POOL. A Waste of $$$$ for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Craigen

customer_reviews.title: Love this pool
customer_reviews.text: Love this pool! I've had it over a month, emptied it, wiped it, and turned it upside down to empty it quite a few times already and no holes yet. It seems very durable and a great size. My two young boys play in it with plenty of space and I can even lay in it at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Have your own personal pool party!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'3" and have enough room to float in this pool. The pool seems durable enough, but don't even try blowing this up without a pump. You would pass out first!😄 The bottom isn't inflated, which mean put it on something comfortably padded if you want your own bottom cushioned. Then fill er up, grab a cool drink, turn on the tunes and chill. Think of it as a cheap vacation.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: I’m not sure what happened to this pool but...
customer_reviews.text: It deflated by the fourth use. In order to inflate this pool you need a pump. The size is great for my almost two yo and my 5 yo to play. Unfortunately the pool deflated while the kids were in there. The pool was half way full, placed on nice grass, under shade. I’m thinking it got a whole somewhere because it was inflated again, and left without water Overnight, but it was deflated again in the am. I will not buy this product if you are expecting repeated use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inflatable pool wont stay inflated.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this pool to use while out of work. It's the perfect size, however it will not stay blown up. Theres no leak, the plugs keep popping out. I finally got it blown up and once I got it filled with water the plugs popped out again. Tried a second time and the same thing happened. I bought a cover for it so I wouldn't waste water. There goes that 🙄
customer_reviews.author: N travis

customer_reviews.title: Has a leak after the first use
customer_reviews.text: Second time to air up this pool and one section was already deflating. Same thing happened with the last Intex pool I bought, but I decided to give it another chance. It was on grass, no rocks or sticks around, no hole to be found, just slowly leaking. (Edit: Third time to air up the pool, and now both sections are leaking air.)
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time or money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pools for a party for the kids to stay cool in. It was easy to inflate so the one star us for that. After inflating I noticed that the plugs wouldn't stay in and kept popping out. If that was the only problem I'd probably just duct tape, but unfortunately that wasn't the only problem. The valve housing on the top and the bottom both had slits in them so the air was leaking out. So I thought ok fine, what are the odds that the other one would be the same and checked the second box. Same damm thing! Don't they have quality assurance? How can both boxes have slits on both housing valves? Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: thyda alolong

customer_reviews.title: several tiny holes
customer_reviews.text: When I used it the 1st time it slowly deflated itself slowly. I did not know much. After 3rd and 4 uses, it started to deflate faster. I had to re inflate every 30 minutes. I later found out that there are many tiny little holes . I had to patch them all (7 of them in total). Beautiful, colorful design but cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Picaso

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Top ring deflates constantly. No holes found, seal is tight, ordered an replacement and that was damaged on arrival so it's been disappointing all around.
customer_reviews.author: Nye

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: It’s an adorable unisex pool. It fits 2-3 toddlers or a couple adults at a time. I dislike how the drain plug is on the bottom facing the ground - you have to hold the plus open so it’s time consuming. The side is divided into 2 chamber rings - the bottom ring got an air leak after just a couple uses and it was from nothing we did as we were gentle with everything.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime H.

customer_reviews.title: Taken advantage of and ripped off !
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great about the product except that you, took advantage, and over tripled the price due to the Pandemic and all pools were closed.
customer_reviews.author: EDGAR R VONDERSMITH SR

customer_reviews.title: Defective product...bummed out.
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed with this product. Intel is a great company....we've had many of their pools and they usually work great....good products. However... I think this pool is a lemon. I never used it....I filled it with air. No problem. But after filling it with water half-full, the pool collapsed on one side. The air chambers were filled with water! Lots of water. So there is a defect somewhere. Come on, Intel, you can do better!! You've got a defect in your manufacturing!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn C. Waddel

customer_reviews.title: You have to pay $30 to return and who knows when you get credit!
customer_reviews.text: If you need to return this pool unopened, you have to have their approval! They make you pay for return postage which was $30! And they still haven’t credited the return. I would not recommend this business.
customer_reviews.author: Alegro Publishing (Consignment)

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this pool
customer_reviews.text: Sadly we got exactly one swim out of this pool we bought for our two year old grandson. Next day it was deflated. It will not stay inflated. In the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Danitta Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pool at the end of the season last year. I never opened it until today , for my grandchildren. It was up for about 1/2 hour and 50% of the air came out. It needs a special adapter that is not stated on the box. I know it is to late to ask for money back. But I just want everyone to know this was $50 wasted. I am going to rethink about all the stuff I buy from Amazon. 100% dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Leaky, deflated, flimsy, disappointing. Counterfeit?
customer_reviews.text: The only worthwhile thing about this product is its big size. The material is so cheap that it had holes before we even filled it, event though we were extremely careful with it. We used it four tines and had to put at least 7 patches on the bottom for water leaks. Now one of the air rings is deflated and leaking so this is headed for the trash. Also, the patches that come with this product are worthless. They stick about as well as apiece of scotch tape in water. This product was so badly made that I suspect it is likely counterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plug Broke After A Handful Of Uses
customer_reviews.text: We loved this pool and we’re so excited to use it. It inflated perfectly the first time and was just the right size for our deck. After using it a handful of times the plug pulled right out of the pool, leaving a huge hole in the bottom. I’m so disappointed! I fully expected to use this pool at least for another summer. Intek usually has better quality than this!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Found tear on the plugs, is useless
customer_reviews.text: ***EDIT: After I emailed the company about the tears, they got back to me within minutes saying they’d send another pool ASAP no questions asked. I received another pool about a day later. I’m so impressed with the costumer service and now give them 5 stars!** I’m so disappointed! I ordered this pool last summer and it was great. It lasted the whole summer without any holes or deflation. I ordered another one for this summer and when I opened it up, found a tear through both of the plugs at the same location. It’s useless because it won’t hold air. So frustrating and disappointing!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Nice sized inflatable pool!
customer_reviews.text: Got this because our neighborhood pool was closed due to covid and we are in hot sunny Florida. This pool exceeded my expectation by far. My 8 year old son and myself (a grown woman) can both fit. He plays in there and has a blast! And he’s not gentle. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rene

customer_reviews.title: Nice pool for the summer
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this pool since quarantine started so about two months. It is a nice size - big enough for two adults. It has held up really well so far. I do have one small hole on the bottom of pool but the patch seems to be doing fine. My full grown Lab jumps in it and it still holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we didn’t get to open this until months after we purchased it because we let someone borrow our air pump and just now got it back. I went to fill up the pool for the kids this afternoon and the lower portion has a hole in it. Really disappointed after paying almost $30 for this.
customer_reviews.author: sbado

customer_reviews.title: Great pool for little ones
customer_reviews.text: We love this pool. My 4 year old and 1 year old love it. Have had no issues with its construction, we are able to keep it empty and propped up without airing for 2 weeks, before we had to add just a tad bit. It is big enough to fit both my kids and I.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G

customer_reviews.title: Good but Need a New One Every Summer
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, it's a good size for several kids (maybe even several adults if you're hot and desperate) but I end up having to buy a new one every summer because it pops. I don't know why it's impossible to find a blow up pool that won't break.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper123

customer_reviews.title: So far it has withstood 4 toddlers and 2 elementary ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it has withstood 4 toddlers and 2 elementary aged children! We haven't had any problems with the plugs coming out while the kids play and swim or it losing air. Only negative comment would be, the drain plug is much too small, it takes forever to drain.
customer_reviews.author: Gladwin

customer_reviews.title: Double check the air plugs!
customer_reviews.text: Used our air mattress pump to blow it up in no time. Make sure you push the plugs in well. They seemed in but one popped right out the moment a kid landed on the edge. The drain in the bottom is nice but tends to get sucked closer with the flow of water going out. I held it out of the way using a cup. It’s a good size for two kids to play around in nicely. They loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Reviewreader

customer_reviews.title: Great pool for the price.
customer_reviews.text: During this quarantine, I needed something for the kids to play in outside, and this definitely did the trick! Big enough for my 9 year old and 4 year old to play together comfortably in. I even joined in and we all fit. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BELIEVE THE HIGH RATINGS!!!
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE! DO NOT BE FOOLED BY RATINGS! It will not stay deflated. This is not a matter of there being a hole on the pool, the pool just does not hold air and it WILL deflate. AMAZON WILL NOT REFUND YOU unless you take apart this mess and buy yourself a new box to put it in. You will be seriously disappointed if you purchase this. The seller is clearly not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: daniella c.

customer_reviews.title: Great size for several kids
customer_reviews.text: Got this mainly for my grandkids as I was having an adult birthday party and wanted to give them something to do also. There were 2 toddlers and 4 boys from 5 to 10 and they really had a great time in it and it was big enough for all of them to play and cool off (we live in the Vegas area). It held up very well and was easy to put up, take down and store for the next time they come visit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Valve opening tore after one use (thin material?)
customer_reviews.text: Used only once and the valve area tore (see photo). I opened valve to let it water drain out and when I went to clean it so it could air dry before putting it away I noticed the valve portion was ripped....how does this happen? It’s not like I yanked the valve cover with excessive force. Going to figure out if there’s a way to salvage it but highly unlikely. When it was inflated and filled with water it was great and seemed very sturdy but didn’t expect the material to be so flimsy that it would just tear like that.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Grandkids loved it
customer_reviews.text: Good size and fit on our back deck. Put a tarp underneath to protect the pool and deck. Don't see how more than two kids can play in it without bumping into each other constantly, but since it was just my two grandsons it was perfect. Even if it pops next summer, I'll still be happy and feel it was a cheap investment for hours of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small kids and short term use
customer_reviews.text: The pool was as described I had an air mattress pump that worked to inflate the pool but it was hard to get it as firm as I would have liked. My grandsons had a blast using it for 3 or 4 days and it held up well. However the plastic is rather thin and I suspect it would not hold up well for a long summer of use It should be on a level site.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I buy this inflatable pool every year! Great price, and great product. Never had an issue with it. I leave it in the sun all day and it still stays in good shape. You can’t beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: BDB

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Durable.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this at least five times and it’s still holding up well. I’m pretty sure the trick to caring for it is not to overfill it with air, we put it on a blanket on the grass, and empty it after every use. I have a 5 and 3 year old that play in it. They don’t play lightly in it, and it still hasn’t popped.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Vieth

customer_reviews.title: DOES Not Last
customer_reviews.text: We got about 2 days out of this. The first day I blowed it up, the next day it was already deflating slowly. Then it got stained by every thing, not quality at all! I had to throw it out... waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa S

customer_reviews.title: Super Durable
customer_reviews.text: I had this pool for FOUR years and it just died (still can't find the hole, but it's losing air). In that time frame, I only had to patch one small hole, which was easy to find since it was on the inside and you could see bubbles. It was used for 2-3 adults for lounging (read: day drinking) purposes a few times each summer. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Young

customer_reviews.title: You are taking a chance if you buy this pool.
customer_reviews.text: Quality control is poor. This pool had a hole in the lower chamber right out of the box. The hole was made by the large valve plug. I know this because the small knob pattern on the plug was embossed around the hole with the hole created by one knob. The upper chamber also had the same embossed pattern created by the valve but no hole. The hole was probably created when the pool was packed in the box. So if you buy this pool you are taking a chance of getting a defective pool. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pool as a cheap and quick pop up pool for the kids down at the shore house. With heavy use it may not last an entire season, but for the price, it certainly served its purpose for the week.
customer_reviews.author: Scott O.

customer_reviews.title: Pool
customer_reviews.text: The pool got a hole despite taking good care of it and the drain is worthless. That being said it lasted one summer with the patch but it did need to be reinflated almost every day. I contacted the company (intex) because maybe i just received a dud (my neighbor was fairly happy with hers) but they weren't very nice or helpful.
customer_reviews.author: ZS

customer_reviews.title: Too cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: We had a similar pool several years ago (same manufacturer) that held up well. This got used ONE TIME. When my husband tried to pull the plug the bottom of the pool ripped around the drain. I think they’ve decreased the thickness of the bottom and it shows. I know it’s reasonably priced but I expect more than one use - totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Holding up after a full summer with 3 kids!
customer_reviews.text: My kids (6, 4, 1) used this pool all summer last year, and it's still holding up! My 6-foot husband can sit in it comfortably, along with a few kids. Happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa J.

customer_reviews.title: Leak after being used a few times
customer_reviews.text: The pool looses air and has a leak after about being used about 5-6 times only. Such a waste to use so much plastic for a product that will be barely used. The manufacturer should make more reliable products.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold air
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box on our new pool this spring and the kids were pumped! It was easy to unfold and inflate. Unfortunately, before I could even get it filled the bottom tube had lost so much air that the pool was mostly useless. I can't seem to find the leak, meaning this whole thing is garbage. Not impressed. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gary K

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pool last year , it was $ 25 dollars , now is more than 100 wow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Air Leaking Out Of The Lower Air Chamber
customer_reviews.text: Inflated the pool.Everything seemed fine.Added the water to the fill line and noticed hours later,pool seemed to be listing to one side.The bottom chamber is losing air.Drained and refilled the pool 2 more times after inflating the Chambers to proper size...but same thing happens each time...pool's lower chamber loses air and sags to one side.Gets worse each day. Will have to return this item.A waste of $ 30.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Gula

customer_reviews.title: Deflated while playing
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great poo for the price, but it deflates often. I have to keep blowing it up. Also you’ll need something to blow it up, like a air compressor, shop vac, or ever a hair dryer set to cool!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie

customer_reviews.title: Tore in 3 places on the First Day
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how on earth this thing is so flimsy. It feels fine but we ended up with 3 holes in different places all over the pool, on the first day. Otherwise, it'd be great.
customer_reviews.author: zanna

customer_reviews.title: Holds Water
customer_reviews.text: We really like this pool, gets the job done holds water & our kids play in it. Only rrason we gave it a 4 star is because the cap that covers the inflate hole can be tempermental and pop out & start deflating the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Molina

customer_reviews.title: 2nd use and won't hold air
customer_reviews.text: This pool was great the first time I used it. The second time, it wouldn't hold air on the top layer. After 6 weeks, I was outside of Amazon's return window. I contacted Intex directly and they wouldn't do anything for me either. I don't want to buy another one then to have the same thing happen again. Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Loads of fun
customer_reviews.text: My 3 kids love this pool. We even filled if with shaving cream one day and it cleaned off super easy! I blew it up with the. Cold setting on my hair dryer in a few minutes. I only wish the bottom was a little thicker. Overall a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: BUY A PUMP! This pool has 2 rings you have to inflate so you definitely need a pump. We got a $23 pump from target and it worked great! Fully inflated in about 10 minutes. Maybe less! This pool is perfect for several little kiddos or easily a few adults to just relax in. Don’t overfill and you should be just fine! It’s even got a drain on the bottom for ease when you’re done. My kiddos love it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Mary J.

customer_reviews.title: Great Pool, Great Size
customer_reviews.text: When our last pool was returned due to a leak, we decided on this one, and we are beyond happy with it! It's a spacious pool that allows my kiddos slide around & play with ease. Even though the side walls are inflatable, they seem fairly sturdy & durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S.

customer_reviews.title: Got this item for some summer fun. It's a perfect size for my two and ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this item for some summer fun. It's a perfect size for my two and four-year-old. We can put more kids in there as well. Throw a couple little toys in there and they'll play for hours! It was easy to blow up and is really strong on the sides. It was a great purchase for the summer. Even my dog jumped in it quite a few times and it hasn't popped!
customer_reviews.author: Levi and Jessica Miller

customer_reviews.title: How big it is
customer_reviews.text: I researched a couple inflatable pool and found this one to have the best reviews. It took me less then 5 min to inflate it using my machine. It’s bigger then I thought and it doesn’t deflate right away... perfect for the summer and worth every penny. There’s enough room for me and the kids.
customer_reviews.author: E. Steffy

customer_reviews.title: Drain plug ripped out after first use
customer_reviews.text: What a great pool, until you try to drain it 😞 it plug ripped right out after one use! Totally bummed my kiddos loved this pool the first few days. Now it’s garbage...
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: It's big and has withstood the 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: The lovely thing about this pool is that not only does it look big in the pictures, but it is big in real life (you'll be surprised). Not big enough for multiple adults, but definitely big enough for several children to have a blast splashing and playing with each other.
customer_reviews.author: M. Conroy

customer_reviews.title: Durable, reliable and a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great pool, great price! I almost didn’t buy it because of some of the negative reviews, but figured it couldn’t hurt to give it a shot, since Amazon’s return/refund policy is so reliable. I’m so glad I did! Bigger than I thought. Three adults and two kids had plenty of room to move around. No problems with it losing air or anything. Quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty cool!
customer_reviews.text: My only issue which didn’t bother me at all, the print was different than what the model above shows! I mean I’m not buying it for the design anyway so that didn’t really bother me but just a heads up! If you order this pool the design in the pic my look a bit different but other than that it’s a nice pool!
customer_reviews.author: Noah Nagle

customer_reviews.title: Just got it looks good so far
customer_reviews.text: Thank you. Looks good so far. She is happy. Doesn’t want to leave this inflatable pool. Will report back on its sturdiness and durability. So far so good. :) 🙏🙏
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Great pool
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this over this past summer and it has been perfect. It’s large enough for 4-6 small kids. The sides are tall enough to keep toddlers in. Ours got a small pinhole one one side but I used the included patch to fix it and had no other issues with it. I like the plug in the bottom for easy drainage.
customer_reviews.author: dusty_moose

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTE GARBAGE!!!! Do not waste your money. Takes FOREVER to inflate, and starts to deflate after only an hour of use. Air plugs are almost impossible to close and by the time you get it closed a lot of the air has already leaked out. I will never buy another product from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Connor

customer_reviews.title: Nice pool for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this last minute for my daughters "water party". It held up to about 15 kids piled in it, jumping in and out all day! Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Gilman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I had this blown up in less than 5 minutes with the help of an air mattress pump. The quality is great and I’m not overly concerned about it tearing or popping, even with it being set up on grass. I got in there with my 2 toddlers and it was the perfect size for the 3 of us!!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Kids loved it!...almost going on a month with the pool and it hasn't had any holes!!! if your wondering if bigger children fit i would say definitely! These are the ages that enjoyed the kids pool with no problem lol 30,26,7,4,3! Buy it you wont regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: great quality for good price
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and plenty big. My toddler loved bouncing off of the edge and it still held air well. Easy to inflate and walls held up with being filled with water
customer_reviews.author: Kat06

customer_reviews.title: Great pool for adults and kids
customer_reviews.text: This is a fab pool for the whole family to cool off on a hot summer day. Hubs can lay flat and float to his heart's content. Well made and great price.
customer_reviews.author: Pepsigirl15

customer_reviews.title: Had air leak the day it arrived and I pumped it up!
customer_reviews.text: I read that many had issues as soon as they blew it up and it had a air leak. I thought it could have been from a bad batch but the same thing happened to me. Also took 21 days to ship to me from date I ordered. If you decide to chance it, I would blow it up the day it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Cost and durability
customer_reviews.text: What a great find!! Grandchildren coming for Labor Day, quick order and it’s here. We had fours days of good fun I. This pool, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great size but not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: First time that we inflated the pool the bottom of the two rings started slowly deflating. I reached out to INTEX for support, they suggested that I find the hole and repair it. Hole could not be located and now the top ring deflates as well too. Pool is no longer usable after about 2 months of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Summer fun
customer_reviews.text: Great value, great pool for kids and adults can fit too! I bought an electric pump and it was so easy to inflate and enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Eyeris

customer_reviews.title: Air leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this pool...but I don't. It's cute and I like that the plastic/vinyl is chemical free. However, the darn thing doesn't hold air! We have to refil the bottom chamber every. Single. Day. Very annoying and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Krystine Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Not sure how most people fill this ...
customer_reviews.text: My Grandkids ages 2 and 4 bounced, swam, and basically beat this thing up with their flipping in and out of the pool. It stood up to their abuse and never lost air. Great buy. Not sure how most people fill this with air as the hole is very large. My husband has a compressor and we used it to fill with some finagling to block the airflow coming back out of the hole while we filled it. Other than that, it was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Tony C.

customer_reviews.title: Great pool!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this at my parents house and it's awesome! We used it all last summer and will do so again this summer. No holes yet. We've taken good care of it though. Cleaned it every once in a while with dish soap and a rag. Empty it every night. Make sure no rocks are in it. Put it away for winter. It's a pretty big pool too! Fits my two kids, plus a couple brave adults in there just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up!
customer_reviews.text: We had great luck with another family sized Intex pool over the past 2 years, so I was happy to try a new one this year. So far, I'm very happy with it! This pool is a great size! My kids, myself, and a bunch of pool toys all fit comfortably. It has two compartments that are easily filled, in less than 10 minutes, using a battery operated air pump. The drain plug in the bottom is perfect for clean-up when we're done. I look forward to using this all summer with my kids!
customer_reviews.author: April S.

customer_reviews.title: I loved this pool
customer_reviews.text: Initially, I loved this pool. The shape and colors made it fun. It was easy to inflate and deflate. However, it wasn't very sturdy. After the 2nd use, it popped. It was on level ground, in the grass and I have no idea what made it pop. I probably would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie G

product_meta.title: Intex Swim Center Paradise Inflatable Pool, 103in X 63in X 18in, for Ages 3+
product_meta.description:
Intex Recreation Swim Center Paradise Lagoon Pool, Age 3+

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Enjoy this paradise blue lagoon pool, which is 103" x 63" x 18" big amd spacious for everyone.
feature_bullets: 2 air chambers wach with double valve intake and free-flow exhaust vavle
Includes a repair patch and a shelf box
Allows for 12 in. depth of water; Capacity is 151 gallons
2 air chambers wach with double valve intake and free-flow exhaust vavle
The dimensions are 103" x 63" x 18", 14 gallon vinyl pool

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,992 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
